dublin_core.dcvalue: In order to investigate the exposure of operational personnel to radiofrequency electromagnetic fields when working for a mobile telephone operator exposimeters were used to make individual records on 23 Technical Operations personnel mobile telephone maintenance staff and also on 22 Other Workers The exposure densities to which each of the 45 subjects was subjected were quantified using 229 exposure indicators Cluster analysis techniques were applied to the data in an attempt to show that they would re emerge as belonging to one of the two groups i e the Technical Operational Personnel group or the Other Workers group This exploratory investigation has shown that the cluster analysis does not reveal a sufficiently reliable emergence of the two groups even though certain exposure indicators were significantly different for the two groups In addition the use of a Learning Group method does not lead to the discovery of a predictive law that could identify the Technical Operational Personnel as a sub group within the overall group
Occupational exposure to ambient electromagnetic fields of technical operational personnel working for a mobile telephone operator.
